title: Cooking Techniques
description: Explore culinary methods and technique vocabulary from the world of cooking

questions.question: In cooking, what does 'blanching' mean?
options: Briefly boiling food then plunging it into ice water to stop the cooking

questions.question: What does 'braising' involve?
options: Searing food at high heat then slowly cooking it in a covered pot with liquid

questions.question: In culinary terms, what does 'julienne' mean?
options: Cutting food into thin, uniform matchstick-shaped strips

questions.question: What is 'deglazing' in cooking?
options: Adding liquid to a hot pan to loosen and dissolve the browned food residue

questions.question: What does 'fold' mean as a cooking technique?
options: Gently combine a light mixture into a heavier one without deflating it
Fold the dough in half repeatedly

questions.question: In cooking, what does 'sauteing' involve?
options: Cooking food quickly in a small amount of fat over high heat

questions.question: What is 'basting' in cooking?
options: Pouring or spooning pan juices or liquid over food during cooking to keep it moist

questions.question: What does 'chiffonade' mean in culinary terms?
options: Finely slicing herbs or leafy greens into thin ribbons

questions.question: In cooking, what does 'reduce' mean?
options: Simmer a liquid to evaporate water and concentrate the flavor

questions.question: What is 'poaching' as a cooking method?
options: Gently cooking food in liquid that is kept just below boiling
Cooking food in a paper pouch

questions.question: What does 'emulsify' mean in cooking?
options: Combine two liquids that normally don't mix, like oil and vinegar, into a stable mixture

questions.question: In culinary terms, what is 'mise en place'?
options: Having all ingredients measured, prepared, and organized before cooking begins
The main course of a meal

questions.question: What does 'al dente' mean when cooking pasta?
options: Cooked so it is still firm when bitten

questions.question: What is 'tempering' in cooking?
options: Losing your temper in the kitchen
Gradually raising the temperature of a cold ingredient by adding small amounts of hot liquid

questions.question: What does 'flambe' mean in cooking?
options: Igniting alcohol in a pan to create a brief burst of flames for flavor
